body_content.explanation: Chromogenic photographs are made using chromogens (= substances that produce colour) to produce a very clear image:
examples: "The Blue Lagoon" is a large chromogenic print showing bathers in one of Iceland's hot springs.
The image shows two chromogenic colour prints from his retrospective at the National Gallery.
Most chromogenic staining methods were developed in the second half of the twentieth century.
Since the chromogenic reaction is concentrated within the bacterial colony, the analysis is straightforward.
